item.title: Discounty: How to Find All Sheep
item.description:
After the Grand Opening in Discounty , Tellar will ask players to meet her after work, and she will ask them if they can strike three trade deals with local merchants. Gamers will have to meet up with Karl at the large tree at the edge of town and try to do business. However, they will find him in distress as he cannot access his home due to the roadblock, and consequently, his sheep have escaped.

In order to get Karl to do business with them in Discounty , players must find all eight of his sheep. If players are having trouble locating the sheep, they've come to the right place, as this guide shows them exactly where they are.

All Sheep Locations in Discounty

Here is where players can find each of Karl's sheep in Discounty:

Sheep

Location

South of Discounty, by the Curious But Cursed stairs

Behind the gate at John Key's Home

In front of the Antique Shop

At the top of the stairs east of the Town Hall

In the front yard of Elmer's Home

Underneath the tree standing in front of Isenkram's Hardware Store

Down at the Harbor, southeast of the Cannery

At the Harbor, at the dock by the Fisher's Boat

Once players have gathered the eight sheep, they must head to the park where a cutscene will ensue. The following day, the tree will be removed, and they can head to the northern part of the map to do business with Karl.

8 Images
8 Images

item.title: Best First Games In Popular Open-World Franchises
item.description:
Summary

  • Successful first games in open-world franchises set a strong foundation for future entries.
  • Establishment of unique gameplay, art style, and story elements in first games attracts fan base.
  • Strong debuts help establish successful franchises, leading to beloved sequels with continued improvements.

Most publishers want to establish popular franchises so that they can market their games to a large number of fans from the get-go. This is especially true in the open-world genre, which is so populated that an established name goes a long way in helping these names stand out from the rest of the pack.

This is why the first games in open-world franchises should be lauded if they manage to be a major hit. They signal the start of something special and ensure that players will be hooked on later entries as long as they keep on improving.

Saints Row

A Promising First Attempt That Set The Foundation For Something Special

6 Images
6 Images
Saints Row
7.0 /10
Released
September 1, 2006

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
18+
Powered by

Saints Row was an admirable start to this beloved series, even if it couldn't shake off the GTA clone accusations for a while. Thankfully, the fun action and great art style ensured that this game would strike a chord with fans.

Eventually, later Saints Row games would establish the wild gameplay and over-the-top humor of this series. It's a shame that the 2022 reboot essentially killed the series, but fans will always hold out hope that Saints Row will make a comeback somewhere down the line.

Assassin's Creed

Players Were Introduced To A Promising Universe With This Tantalizing Game

5 Images
5 Images
Assassin's Creed
7.7 /10
Released
November 14, 2007

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ Due To Blood, Strong Language, Violence
Powered by

After brainstorming a new entry in the Prince of Persia series, Ubisoft decided to go forward with a brand new IP that would let players explore historical settings in detailed simulations. This led to the development of the first Assassin's Creed , which is easily one of the most popular franchises of all time.

Altair's adventures were riveting and introduced players to this compelling world. While Ezio's trilogy may be more important for this franchise's relevance, there's no denying that the first Assassin's Creed game set the groundwork for something special, even if it has been milked a bit too much for most people's liking.

Horizon Zero Dawn

An Excellent Debut For Aloy In This Unique Post-Apocalyptic Title

Horizon Zero Dawn
Adventure
RPG
Systems
Released
February 28, 2017

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
T for Teen - Blood, Drug Reference, Language, Mild Sexual Themes, Violence
Powered by

Guerrilla Games had a tall order ahead of them when they had to create Horizon 's world. The idea of fighting mechanical dinosaurs sounded great, but it'd fall flat if the story didn't do a great enough job of justifying this unique take on a post-apocalyptic world.

Thankfully, Horizon Zero Dawn did a great job of establishing many mysteries with satisfying payoffs. From Aloy's origins to the reason behind the world's destruction, Zero Dawn was a strong first entry in a series that fans loved.

STALKER: Shadow Of Chernobyl

A Challenging Open-World Survival Horror RPG That Struck A Chord With Players

S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Shadow of Chernobyl
8.0 /10
Released
March 20, 2007

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ Due To Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Strong Language, Use of Alcohol
Powered by

The STALKER series has slowly but surely amassed a passionate fanbase that loves everything this title has to offer. They were introduced to the hypnotic trappings of this open-world survival RPG series for the first time with Shadow of Chernobyl .

Exploring the Chernobyl Exclusion Zone and getting their hands on the many anomalies in this game makes for a great time. Shadow of Chernobyl highlighted the immense promise of this franchise, and later games did a great job of building on it.

Mafia

The Story Was Tantalizing And Got People Hooked On The Mafia Series In No Time

3 Images
3 Images
Mafia (2002)
Action-Adventure
Third-Person Shooter
Systems
Released
August 28, 2002

WHERE TO PLAY

PHYSICAL

ESRB
m
Powered by

Mafia manages to shake off the accusations of being a GTA clone by letting fans enjoy one of the best stories in a video game. Fans of movies like The Godfather and Scarface will have a blast with this title.

The remake of this title ensures that getting into the first chapter in the Mafia series will be easier than ever. The story still holds up and makes it clear why the game's success spawned a franchise full of amazing story-driven open-world games.

Xenoblade Chronicles

Helped Establish One Of The Most Popular Modern Nintendo Franchises

Xenoblade Chronicles: Definitive Edition
RPG
Systems
Released
May 29, 2020

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
T For Teen Due To Blood, Mild Language, Partial Nudity, Use of Alcohol and Tobacco, Violence
Powered by

Xenoblade Chronicles is one of the greatest open-world RPGs of all time, with the Xeno series finally enjoying the mainstream attention it deserved. Nintendo's backing ensures that JRPG fans will be eating well with this incredible game.

Shulk and his Monado are iconic and do a great job of making the combat feel better than ever. This, coupled with mech gameplay and incredible environmental design, makes it clear why fans loved what Xenoblade Chronicles brings to the table.

Marvel's Spider-Man

Fans Were Finally Treated To One Of The Best Spider-Man Games That Did Justice To The Webhead's Legacy

Marvel's Spider-Man
9.3 /10
Released
September 7, 2018

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
T For Teen Due To Blood, Drug Reference, Language, Mild Suggestive Themes, Violence
Powered by

After what felt like ages, fans were finally treated to a video game that did justice to the allure of everyone's favorite neighborhood superhero. Marvel's Spider-Man made it clear that Insomniac Studios was the smartest pick for a big-budget Spider-Man game.

The webhead's adventures start on a high note and never let up. With Miles Morales' side adventures and a sequel that lets players control both Spider-Men, it's easy to see why the first game was so important to help establish this beloved franchise.

Red Dead Redemption

John Marston's Adventures Make For An Epic Time In This Western Open-World Game

5 Images
5 Images
Red Dead Redemption
8 /10
20
9.5 /10
Released
May 18, 2010

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ Due To Blood, Intense Violence, Nudity, Strong Language, Strong Sexual Content, Use of Drugs
Powered by

Red Dead Redemption is one of Rockstar's best video games that turned John Marston into one of the most iconic video game protagonists of all time. Players control this man on a journey to hunt down the remnants of his past after the Pinkertons threaten him into this act.

If nothing else, this game is important simply because it set the foundation for what is easily one of Rockstar's greatest sequels. Venturing into Mexico and the game's shocking ending are just a few of the moments that make it clear why Red Dead Redemption had such an immense impact upon launch.

item.title: Escape From Tarkov Confirms 1.0 Release Date
item.description:
Escape From Tarkov is officially leaving beta with its major 1.0 update coming on November 11. Battlestate Games, the developer of Escape From Tarkov , first opened the game to the public in a limited alpha test back in 2016, with the game later moving to a closed beta in 2017, and remaining in that state since.

Players have to pre-purchase the game to get invited to the closed beta, which receives patches and some new content from time to time. In the beta, there is no full campaign, with each game mode being a round-based extraction shooter with PvP and PvE elements. The gameplay has been praised by some and disliked by others, as its survival elements and tactical FPS gameplay can be very unforgiving, but also very rewarding for those who take the time to master the game's various elements. While a lot of how the game functions in this beta reflects how the full game will play, a lot more has always been promised to be coming with the game's eventual full release.

Escape From Tarkov is Finally Releasing Version 1.0

In a YouTube video on Battlestate Games' official channel, a November 11 release date for version 1.0 was announced. The trailer itself is mostly just for show and to announce the release date, with no actual gameplay from Escape From Tarkov shown. Additional information on what version 1.0 will include has yet to be made public, but many speculate that the game's main campaign will be included. The official description of the game says it's a story-driven experience, giving weight to the theory that the 1.0 release will incorporate a main story.

Battlestate Games has announced it will be attending many gaming events over 2025, where it will reveal all sorts of new content for Escape From Tarkov , including PAX West, Tokyo Game Show, Paris Games Week, and G-Star. At the time of the announcement of this tour, the full release of the game had not been revealed, but now it's clear that these events set the stage for great opportunities to reveal what all players can expect from the 1.0 release.

As of now, there are four editions of Escape From Tarkov that players can pre-purchase ahead of the game's release. Even the standard edition of the game offers a few in-game rewards for pre-ordering the full game, with more expensive editions giving exclusive rewards. Each of these versions lets players into the closed beta, where they can experience the core gameplay and get some experience before the game's full launch.

item.title: How To Use Rainbow Energy In Disney Dreamlight Valley (Bing Bong Plushie Guide)
item.description:
There is a secret quest hidden in the Inside Out realm, and players might miss it in Disney Dreamlight Valley . The quest will help players with how to use the Everlasting Cotton Candy or the Rainbow Energy in DDV to craft an adorable item.

How To Use Flashy Diamond In DDV - Disney Dreamlight Valley

The Flashy Diamond is found in HQ, where players first enter the Inside Out realm. Head to the purple tunnel, where there are shelves full of ideas, and interact with the sparkles to get the Flashy Diamond. Keep it in the inventory as the Flashy Diamond is one of two items used to make the Rainbow Energy in DDV .

How To Use Everlasting Cotton Candy In DDV - Disney Dreamlight Valley

While searching for safety gloves during the Emotional Rescue quest in Disney Dreamlight Valley , you can open Joy's locker and grab the Everlasting Cotton Candy, which is used to craft Bing Bong in DDV .

How To Use Tiny Bowler Hat In DDV - Disney Dreamlight Valley

Before meeting Sadness during the Out of the Blue quest, turn around to the nearby cart of memories and pick up the Tiny Bowler Hat next to it, as it is the second item required to make the Bing Bong Plushie in DDV .

How To Use Bright Bulb Lamp In DDV - Disney Dreamlight Valley

After accessing the other section of Long Term Memory during the Get Up and Glow quest, find the hidden routing control puzzle and press the left red button, and then the right one to solve it and reveal a path. Grab the Bright Bulb Lamp to create the Rainbow Energy in Disney Dreamlight Valley .

How To Use Tiny Bowtie In DDV - Disney Dreamlight Valley

The final item to make the Bing Bong Plushie in DDV is the Tiny Bowtie found in the Dream Production area. Search the upper left corner to find it near the blue curtain and some plants.

How To Use Rainbow Energy In DDV - Disney Dreamlight Valley

Using any crafting station, combine the Bright Bulb Lamp and Flashy Diamond to make Rainbow Energy. Dreamers will need Rainbow Energy in DDV since it's the final ingredient to create the Bing Bong Plushie .

How To Craft Bing Bong Plushie In DDV - Disney Dreamlight Valley

Finally, after running around and collecting items, combine the following materials at a crafting station to create the Bing Bong Plushie in DDV .

  • Rainbow Energy
  • Everlasting Cotton Candy
  • Tiny Bowler Hat
  • Tiny Bowtie

If players miss any of the items, they can go back anytime to the Inside Out realm to grab them.

item.title: All Reckoning Easter Eggs in Black Ops 6 Zombies
item.description:
Season 5 for Black Ops 6 is definitely shaping up to be a content-heavy launch after the content drought brought with the release of Season 4 Reloaded. In Season 5, Multiplayer fans can grind through the Battle Pass to unlock two new weapons, battle it out in modes like Snipers Only and Aim High, and jump into a roster of maps, including a remake of W.M.D.

However, the highlight of Season 5's content has to be Reckoning, the final Zombies map that fans can enjoy until the debut of Black Ops 7 . This map has it all, from challenging enemy types to an excellent layout and a series of Easter Eggs that rival those on the maps before it. Here is every Easter Egg you can complete on Reckoning in Black Ops 6 Zombies.

Reckoning Main Quest

First up, and arguably the biggest draw for Reckoning, is its main Easter Egg Quest. Players jumping into the Main Quest are in for a ride, as it is filled with puzzling steps, codes to decipher, and HVT targets to take down, all before culminating in a final decision: either aid S.A.M. in her efforts to become human, or follow Richtofen’s plan to defeat S.A.M. and bring back his family. Whatever choice players make will affect the boss they face, as well as the ending they receive once it is complete.

While the steps leading up to the Main Quest are not the most difficult compared to other maps, each boss fight is definitely challenging. For a full walkthrough on how to complete Reckoning's Main Quest, head to this guide here.

Getting the Gorgofex

While players can get the Wonder Weapon through the Mystery Box and completely skip it, there is also a side quest that allows players to get the Gorgofex. To do this, players will need to decipher a code to open the T1 Bioweapons Lab, fill up a cyst with zombie souls, take said cyst to the T1 Quantum Computing Core to charge it further, and then merge the Forsaken into an Uber Klaus before ultimately defeating him to acquire it.

If this all sounds a little complicated, that would be because it is. For a more detailed breakdown of how to get the Gorgofex Wonder Weapon, check out our dedicated guide here.

Upgrading the Gorgofex

While acquiring the Gorgofex is integral to certain steps of the main Easter Egg quest, upgrading the Gorgofex is entirely optional , but it does offer players some pretty cool upgrades. Upgrading the Gorgofex is a choice-based side quest that, depending on the choices they make, will determine whether players get the Gorgofex C or the Gorgofex N.

For a detailed breakdown of how to get either upgrade, head to this guide here.

Free Power-Ups

Moving on to full-blown side Easter Eggs separate from the main quest, we have the Reckoning's free Power-Ups. Much like the previous maps in Black Ops 6 Zombies, players can find seven free Power-Ups in the Reckoning , and upon collecting them all, an eighth Fire Sale Power-Up will spawn for players to grab.

These free Power-Ups can be super useful, as players can shoot them to activate right away or place a C4 on them and detonate whenever needed. For a full breakdown of the Power-Up locations, head here.

Target Easter Egg (Free Ammo Mod, Aether Tool, & Pack-a-Punch Crystal)

This next Easter Egg may be the best one in Black Ops 6 yet. To complete it, start by turning on the power to activate the Pack-a-Punch Machine. From here, head back to spawn at the T1 Project Janus Reception. At the center of the reception, players can find a Project Janus logo on the floor, followed by a monitor displaying the same image on a desk just in front of it. Stand on the logo and shoot the screen.

From here, players will enter a shooting range-type minigame, where they need to shoot a series of targets around the room while remaining on the logo. This step is timed, with a timer displayed on the desk where the monitor was found. Players simply need to shoot all the targets to earn a reward. This can be repeated after a new round, each time increasing in difficulty, to claim a maximum of three rewards.

Here are the rewards players can get:

  • First completion: Random Ammo Mod
  • Second completion: Aether Tool
    • Uncommon for Rounds 1-5
    • Rare for Rounds 6-10
    • Epic for Rounds 11-20
    • Legendary for Rounds 21 and above

  • Third completion: Pack-a-Punch Aetherium Crystal
    • Tier I for Rounds 1-15
    • Tier II for Rounds 16 and above

Easter Egg Songs

Next up is the Reckoning's own Easter Egg song, which can be triggered by finding and interacting with three separate Mr. Peeks Headphones. Each one can be found in various locations around the map, and once players interact with every one, "Remember Us" by Kevin Sherwood, featuring Elena Siegman will play. For a full breakdown of where to find each headset, visit our dedicated guide here.

However, that is not the only music Easter Egg, as players can trigger a second one to play. To get "Samantha's Peace" to play, players need to run through the metal detectors at the T1 Janus Reception in a specific order. The sequence is as follows: 1, 3, 2, 1, 3, 2. If you are unsure which metal detectors correspond to a particular number, refer to the provided image.

Mister Peeks Easter Egg (Free Perk)

Mister Peeks returns in this next Easter Egg, which rewards players with a free Perk upon completion. To start, head to the T1 Executive Suite and look down from the balcony. Near the bottom of the tower's center, players will find Mr. Peeks. Shoot him to bring him up to the balcony. From there, interact with him , and he will fly down to the T1 Janus Reception, leaving a trail of hoops behind. Simply jump down and parachute through every hoop to collect 1,000 Essence and a free Random Perk Power-Up.

Pool Ball Easter Egg (Free Self-Revive Kit)

In need of a Self-Revive Kit but do not have enough Salvage to craft one? Be sure to head on over to the T1 Director's Office and locate a stack of pool balls mounted on the wall on the far side of the room. From here, shoot the following numbers: 1, 1, 5. Each ball will fall off the shelf and, once all three are shot, a free Self-Revive Kit will drop onto the pool table in front.

Free Deadshot Daiquiri Easter Egg

This next Easter Egg rewards players with a free Deadshot Daiquiri Perk. Start by heading to the T1 Mutant Test Research Area, just by the Ammo Depot near the T1 Bioweapons Lab. From here, shoot the head of the target dummy by the broken wall (or stand in the corner in the T1 Mutant Research Lab and shoot the second target dummy) until you hear a sound cue.

Next, turn away from the T1 Mutant Research Lab and, from the T1 Mutant Test Research Area, look at the crane. Four Deadshot Daiquiri Perk Cans should now be visible. Simply shoot each can one after the other without missing a shot to be awarded a free Deadshot Daiquiri Perk.

Aetherella Easter Egg

While Aetherella is a character featured pretty prominently on Liberty Falls, players can actually get her as an ally in the Reckoning by completing a really quick side Easter Egg. Once complete, Aetherella will follow the player around, firing lasers at zombies and other enemies alike. To complete this Easter Egg, do the following:

  1. Acquire the Gorgofex.
  2. Use a Spray on the cubicle door in the zombie spawn by the Rampage Inducer at the T1 Project Janus Reception.
  3. Fire a charged shot using the Gorgofex at the now revealed Aetherella figurine.
  4. Head to the T2 Sublevel 10 and jump into the particle accelerator's beam to send Aetherella into it.
  5. Exit the beam and jump back in, bumping into Aetherella to complete the Easter Egg.

Chicken Bucket Easter Egg

This next secret may not offer an actual reward, but it can be a fun little Easter Egg to try out with friends. To complete the Chicken Bucket Easter Egg, head to the T1 Executive Suite and throw a grenade at the chicken bucket in the cafeteria. Next, collect the six pieces of chicken scattered around the room. From here, if players head back to the bucket and interact with it, it will be placed onto their heads.

For more information on the locations of each chicken piece, head to this guide here.

Golden Trash Can Easter Egg

This next Easter Egg offers players the ability to rack up some high-tier loot without much effort at all. To complete it, players will need to find and interact with different trash cans , some of which will drop loot while others won't. These trash cans can be found in the following locations:

  • Opposite the Aether Elevator leading to the T1 Quantum Computing Core in the T1 Project Janus Reception
  • Just opposite the Quick Revive Perk Machine
  • Opposite the teleporter near Quick Revive
  • Just to the left of the zombie spawn where you can find Aetherella
  • Just to the right of the Jugger-Nog Perk Machine
  • Found just to the left upon taking the Anti-Grav Personnel Launcher to the T1 Executive Suite
  • By the door where Blanchard can be found
  • To the left of the Ammo Depot in the T1 Executive Suite
  • To the far left of the SVD Wall-Buy in the T1 Executive Suite
  • To the left of the portal leading to the T1 Project Janus Reception within the Director's Office

Once you have found and interacted with each trash can, head back to the T1 Project Janus Reception. Just by the metal detectors, players should find a final trash can, now glowing gold, which rewards players with loot upon interacting with it.

Jumpscare Easter Egg

This next Easter Egg is a quick one, but it’s definitely a fun way to troll your friends. To do it, head to the T1 Executive Suite and, just to the left of the Anti-Grav Personnel Launcher, look off into the distance to spot a picnic blanket. From here, simply aim at the blanket, preferably with a Sniper Scope, to trigger the jumpscare.

Vending Machine Easter Egg

This next Easter Egg is a carryover from Liberty Falls. If players head over to the T2 Android Assembly , they can find a vending machine just opposite the buildable Franken-Klaus. If players melee it each round, it will drop loot items like Salvage, Essence, and potentially a free Perk or Aetherium Crystals. Grabbing Melee Macchiato and destroying the vending machine with its melee will also drop even more loot.

Aether Blade Easter Egg

Rounding out the Easter Eggs for the Reckoning is the ability to obtain the Aether Blade, which requires players to unlock the Mister Peeks Field Upgrade from the '90s Action Heroes Event. To get it, players will need to find three paintings scattered throughout the map and then take them over to the room with the Arsenal in the T1 Director's Office.

Here, place each painting into the designated spots. Then get a Safe Key by detonating an RC-XD in the vent at T2 Dark Entity Containment, and then shooting the crystals that appear on The Forsaken's containment cell. From here, head to the painting to the right of the portal to Pack-a-Punch and activate the Mister Peeks Field Upgrade to reveal a safe , which can then be opened with the key acquired earlier to get the Aether Blade. For more details, head to our dedicated guide here.

Call of Duty: Black Ops 6
9 /10
